full_text: BRE oa x A PEER SE Ten Biaeee 2019/KER/1028 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE K.ABRAHAM MATHEW WEDNESDAY ,THE O9TH DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 19TH POUSHA, 1940 Cr1.MC.No. 210 of 2019 PETITIONER/S: ANSAR AHAMMED SALIM AGED 30 YEARS $/O.M.S.SALIM, MECHERIMALIL HOUSE, KARUKADOM.P.O, PALLIPADY, KOTHAMANGALAM, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT (OWNER OF A TAT, HGV TIPPER, BEARING REGISTRATION NO.KL-04-U-3261). BY ADV. SRI.AJEESH M UMMER RESPONDENT/S: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682031. 2 THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, PERUMBAVOOR POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT-683542. 3 THE DISTRICT COLLECTOR ERNAKULAM DISTRICT-682030. OTHER PRESENT: SRI C S HRITHWIK-SR PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON ee 2019/KER/1028 Crl.MC.No. 210 of 2019 1i2.. 09.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ORDER Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C. 2. The petitioner claims to be the owner of a vehicle seized by the second respondent on the allegation of commission of the offence under the provisions of the Kerala Conservation of Paddy Land and Wet Land Act. The seizure has not been reported to the learned magistrate. The prayer is to direct the second respondent to report the seizure to the learned magistrate concerned. 3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioner and the learned Public Prosecutor. 4, The petitioner may file an application under Section 457 Cr.P.C. before the competent court, which shall call for a report from the second respondent and pass appropriate orders BRE eaten Biaeee 2019/KER/1028 Cr1l.MC.No. 210 of 2019 ..3., on it. With this direction, this Crl.M.C. is closed. Sd/- K.ABRAHAM MATHEW JUDGE APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE 1 TRUE COPY OF THE SEIZURE MAHASSAR PREPARED BY THE SECOND RESPONDENT DATED 29/12/2018 IN CONNECTION WITH SEIZURE OF VEHICLE OF PETITIONER. ANNEXURE 2 TRUE COPY OF THE ORDER DATED 07/12/2018 IN CRL.M.C.8111/2018. Bka/10.01.2019
